page.title: 09Cockerham Parish Hall
page.content: The Hall was built in 1968 in the centre of the village adjoining the Sports field at a cost of Â£13,333, raised by the villagers aided by a grant from Lancs. Education Committee. A committee room costing Â£6000 was added in1971,and in 1980,the lounge, bar & kitchen extended costing Â£16000, aided by a grant from Lancaster City Council Lottery of Â£5000.Of brick & stone construction,it comprises of a main hall 62'X26'used for dances, concerts,large meetings and badminton; a committee room 34'x18'for meetings and play school;a bar,lounge and refreshment area 38'x15';a kitchen and two sets of toilets.It is used by the Badminton club, Young Farmers, Parish Council,Play Group,Mothers' Union,W.I.,Youth Club,Scouts,Guides, Drama Group,Over Sixties club,with private parties & wedding receptions.
